result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anjalo Antonio Hayward

defendant.name: Hayward, Anjalo Antonio
defendant.address: 2533 West Maple Street Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53204

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anjalo Antonio Hayward in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Calendar Call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court lifted the stay of the Bench Warrant.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom.   Case set for pretrial conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 01.  Calendar call scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Anjalo Antonio Hayward
Current: 2533 West Maple Street Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 07-08-2022)
Prior: 2533 West Maple Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anjalo Antonio Hayward in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-8-2022 @2:30p
